metadata.title: CVE-2012-4553 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Drupal 7.x before 7.16 allows remote attackers to obtain sensitiveinformation and possibly re-install Drupal and execute arbitrary PHP codevia an external database server, related to "transient conditions."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-4553` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

drupal7 - 7.14-1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: drupal7 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.14-1.1').
